models.design.project

Class QueueShareStack<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • abstracts.AbstractQueue<T>
      • models.design.project.QueueShareStack<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasInvariant, UnboundedStorageSpecification<T>

    public class QueueShareStack<T>
extends AbstractQueue<T>
implements UnboundedStorageSpecification<T>
    This class is an extension of AbstractQueue and an implementation of UnboundedStorageSpecification
    In this design, stackIn is a composition meanwhile stackOut(temporary) is aggregation
    This implementation follows the requirement: the stackOut is shared among two queues and play a role as temporary stack
    The tested instances of shared stack may be UnreliableStack or ReliableStack
    Author:
    btdiem

      • head

        public T head()
       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Move all elements from stackIn to stackOut
        return the item least recently added to the queue
        Then, move back all elements from stackOut to stackIn
        Specified by:
        head in interface UnboundedStorageSpecification<T>
        Returns:
        head of queue, where the head is the element that has been in the queue for the longest time.
        Does not change the state of the queue
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if we try to read the head of an empty queue

      • pop

        public void pop()
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Move all elements from stackIn to stackOut
        Remove and return the item least recently added to the queue
        Then, move back all elements from stackOut to stackIn
        Specified by:
        pop in interface UnboundedStorageSpecification<T>
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if we try to pop from an empty queue
